comments.body:
Could it be this cron job? https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blob/main/config/schedule.rb#L42-L44

This part seems to remove all incremental Events from the past two months: https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blob/main/lib/tasks/marc_liberation.rake#L5

If the cron job was last run on Sunday, Jan. 1, that would explain why everything before November is missing.
@sandbergja you are right! I totally forgot about this job and the date that these events were cleared made me think that something else was going on. I'm closing this as resolved. Thanks !
@cwulfman This still has a lot of the Lunr functionality from #23 — some of it may still be needed, but it would be helpful to remove what isn't needed to make it clearer how Fuse works.
removed the lunr code

dspace-development.title: Update the X.509 certificate for oaworkflow.princeton.edu for Symplectic Elements

comments.body:
Digital Science has encountered an error while trying to upgrade with the renewed certificate:

> In order to have a SSL certificate, the on call engineer switched the SSL server from letsencrypt.org PRODUCTION to STAGE server after a phone call with me. In this manner, there's a certificate, but it's marked as not valid by the browsers as it's not issued by the PRODUCTION Certificate Authority.
>​
> We can mitigate the actual situation in 2 manners:
> - use a certificate that your institution provides (manual process, and it will need to be addressed at a later point again)
> - continue to use letsencrypt and switch back to PRODUCTION CA server after your IT team solves the rate limits mentioned in the above link.

Referencing the documentation, LetsEncrypt does not permit rate limits to be increased without a waiting period last several weeks:

![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5b5b6aed981c3204c9ed06c8/871c7453-5ebf-40f8-8e51-82a84e991f6b)

Hence I will need to address this by providing the X.509 from OIT.
These have been provided to members of Digital Science. I am awaiting their feedback regarding the certificates being in the required formats.

figgy.title: Redesign the preservation status indicators on the resource show page

comments.body:
I think the health report looks great! I like the icons and the button. Is the destination for that button a different issue?

The wording is still a confusing to me, I don't know what it means for the files to be the same as or different from the ones previously checked on a given date. For example, if there are 3 file sets, on a resource, there would be 3 preservation objects for the file sets plus 1 for the resource. The FixityRequestor randomly selects a bunch of preservation objects to check fixity on. So these 3 files (plus the resource metadata itself) could have been queued for checks on wildly different dates.  What is the "as of" date? and what is the "previously checked" date?

orangelight.title: Available items in firestone$pf and in SCSB display label status Available -  In Process

comments.body:
I searched again in scsb items with barcode: 32101053105035. This time they display 'out'. 
![Screen Shot 2023-01-05 at 9 55 22 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9905193/210920665-bdf5baa3-5cb7-4ade-a6f0-66177107cb9c.png)

![Screen Shot 2023-01-05 at 9 55 17 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9905193/210920684-f9998e32-f2d9-4125-9644-e1fe2724ade8.png)

This might be the reason but it needs more investigation so that we have a clear picture.

I remember that during the circulation meeting (1/4/2023) @mzelesky checked this barcode and it was available 'In'. This was the main confusion. 
Now it is 'OUT' which makes more sense to have the 'In Process'.

Response from scsb availability status response
https://scsb.recaplib.org:9093/sharedCollection/bibAvailabilityStatus 
[
  {
    "itemBarcode": "",
    "itemAvailabilityStatus": null,
    "errorMessage": "Bib Id doesn't exist in SCSB database.",
    "collectionGroupDesignation": null
  }
]

The mmsid that this item is assigned in alma doesn't exist in RECAP.
The item in Alma is 'Item in Place''.

Bring this to the circulation meeting to Marie and @mzelesky.
This is a data issue.

Why are we allowing partial matches on DOI and ark?

pdc_describe.title: We should not allow partial matches
Minimalist UI for prov and messages

comments.body:
@mccalluc I love the appearance of the provenance! It is perfect. Thank you so much. : )

I'm not sure why the messages (currently called "comments") look this way though. It should only be the provenance that has this appearance and message feature should be more consistent with how messages typically look. Regarding messages, I just wrote a ticket for changes to the messaging feature that was discussed in our last feature refinement meeting. Bess just took a look at it and said the ticket was actionable. You might also want to have a look: #823. Please feel welcome to comment or ask questions.

> I'm not sure why the messages (currently called "comments") look this way though.

Both sections were using the same style before, so the simplest change was to make a single change, rather than adding special cases. But that is doable. I'll update this PR.
@mccalluc Thanks, much appreciated!
Updated screen shot, with a distinct style for messages, and other recent features merged in. #823 will be handled separately: We want to keep this to a small set of changes.

comments.body:
I ran in dev and staging: 

```
AspaceIndexJob.perform_later(resource_descriptions_uri: "/repositories/5/archival_objects/924592", repository_id: "mms")
```

and got the error:
```
NoMethodError: undefined method `text' for nil:NilClass

      cache.ead_id = Nokogiri::XML.parse(content).remove_namespaces!.xpath("//eadid")[0].text
```

Linking the honeybadger issue: https://app.honeybadger.io/projects/65922/faults/92241057
